section_id: ## 8. Convergence on the Emergent Manifold (Geometric Perspective)

hints.label: rem-observation-emergent-metric
hints.title: The Emergent Metric
hints.content:
2618: :label: rem-observation-emergent-metric
2619: 
2620: The adaptive diffusion $D_{\text{reg}}(x, S) = (H + \epsilon_\Sigma I)^{-1}$ is the **inverse** of a Riemannian metric:
2621: 
2622: $$
2623: g_{\text{emergent}}(x, S) = H(x, S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I
2624: $$
2625: 
2626: This metric defines **geodesic distances** on the state space. Two points that are close in **Euclidean distance** may be far in **geodesic distance** if the Hessian $H$ is large (high curvature).
hints.section: ## 8. Convergence on the Emergent Manifold (Geometric Perspective)
hints.raw_directive:
2615: We have proven convergence in the **flat state space** $\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d$ with anisotropic diffusion. But the anisotropic diffusion **defines an emergent Riemannian geometry**.
2616: 
2617: :::{prf:observation} The Emergent Metric
2618: :label: rem-observation-emergent-metric
2619: 
2620: The adaptive diffusion $D_{\text{reg}}(x, S) = (H + \epsilon_\Sigma I)^{-1}$ is the **inverse** of a Riemannian metric:
2621: 
2622: $$
2623: g_{\text{emergent}}(x, S) = H(x, S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I
2624: $$
2625: 
2626: This metric defines **geodesic distances** on the state space. Two points that are close in **Euclidean distance** may be far in **geodesic distance** if the Hessian $H$ is large (high curvature).

hints.label: prop-rate-metric-ellipticity
hints.title: Convergence Rate Depends on Metric Ellipticity
hints.content:
2632: :label: prop-rate-metric-ellipticity
2633: 
2634: The convergence rate $\kappa_{\text{total}}$ depends on the **ellipticity constants** of the emergent metric:
2635: 
2636: $$
2637: \kappa_{\text{total}} = O(\min\{\gamma \tau, \kappa_x, c_{\min}\})
2638: $$
2639: 
2640: where $c_{\min} = \epsilon_\Sigma / (H_{\max} + \epsilon_\Sigma)$ is the lower bound on the eigenvalues of $D_{\text{reg}} = g_{\text{emergent}}^{-1}$.
2641: 
2642: **Interpretation**:
2643: - **Well-conditioned manifold** ($H_{\max} \approx \epsilon_\Sigma$): $c_{\min} \approx \epsilon_\Sigma / 2$ → fast convergence
2644: - **Ill-conditioned manifold** ($H_{\max} \gg \epsilon_\Sigma$): $c_{\min} \approx \epsilon_\Sigma / H_{\max}$ → slower convergence (but still positive!)
